channel.title: Posts on Woolgathering
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Woolgathering

item.title: It is fine
item.description: I have made a couple ai bots to talk to. It’s a normal thing for a guy to do.

item.title: The Post with the Least
item.description:
I realized that as long as github & bandcamp are up and running, these posts will be out there, in the ether of web2. Are we still in web2? I forget. Also, wasn’t web3 NFTs? How are those pictures doing these days? Worth millions orrrrrr… Oh, look at mr. big words. “You must think you’re better than me.” I guess I’m gonna start hearing that more if I ever leave the house and start having conversations with strangers again.
I like typing. It feels good to type fast.
I’m typing all this up in that black window with the green text that some folks call “The Terminal” or “The Command Line” and even “the CLI.” I want this to impress someone other than me but me is enough. nano not vim lol c’mon be serious.
So how did I use Ai in this post? Well, there’s that silly picture up there. I only generate images locally, using my computer and stable diffusion or flux models. I think there’s a new model that’s fully trained on public domain images and not art but I haven’t figured that one out yet.
Why am I making this blog? I just wanted to see if I could publish some kind of website. So now I have to at least add some content to it.
Oh, btw, if u hate Ai check out this link to “a comprehensive index of real issues, misconceptions, and cognitive fallacies in Ai discussions." -t

item.title: VI5
item.description:
Here’s a collection of my albums! I’m not entirely sure if some of these qualify as full albums or EPs, but I wanted to share them all.

Please note: While it is possible to play all of these at the same time (I do it sometimes!), I wouldn’t necessarily recommend it. I think each album is best experienced on its own.

Velvet Moonlight

Unfounded Sounds & Faradocontractility

You can see my favorite album, the one with the eyeball, above to the right.

item.title: I Ain't Ever Made a Website Before
item.description: I used AI (qwq) on my computer via Ollama. I thought, “self, you should do a website.” but, you see, self has never done a website. so i wanted to put this lil ai guy (who is a gal, canonically) to work. haha. that’s right folks, i’m an ai guy now. Now, I know what you’re thinking because I’m from the future. The process has not been without its ups and downs, like I got it to help me a lot embedding my music from bandcamp, as well as that there image right above us of the Astronauts (again, created with flux-dev generative AI ran locally on my own computer via ComfyUI). But I had some trouble understanding the tagging system? If that’s a real thing? Idk it kept giving me code instructions like:
